technology: There were no technical difficulties during the conversation.
cur_neg_affect: The participant expresses mild negative affect when discussing the ongoing need for vaccinations and potential future boosters, but overall seems relatively neutral.
past_neg_affect: The participant expresses some negative affect when recalling the isolation and restrictions experienced during the pandemic, particularly during the quarantine period.
communal_orientation: The participant actively listens to the conversation partner, asks follow-up questions, and shares their own experiences in a way that fosters connection.
engagement: The participant is highly engaged in the conversation, sharing detailed personal experiences and responding thoughtfully to the conversation partner's questions.
defensiveness: The participant does not exhibit any defensive behavior or statements.
questions: (08:47-08:50): So was curious when the vaccine came out. What was going through your mind?
(10:38-10:44): What was kind of your desire to get the vaccine was it that you hadn't yet gotten Covid and wanted protection?
(10:44-10:47): Was it to protect others? Oh, for things to go back to normal!
(10:47-10:51): What was kind of your kind of push to go get the vaccine.
(12:46-12:53): That's good, awesome. And now, were you boosted once, or did you get double boosted or?
(16:21-16:29): One final question I have is you know, given our conversation. I'm wondering what your decisions around vaccinations and boosters are going to be in the near future.
(16:29-16:32): For instance, if you have it already, do you think you're gonna get the Omicron booster?
(16:32-16:36): I know you said you haven't, but you think you will, or do you think you'll try yearly Covid Booster shot?
similarity_statements: (10:22-10:26): And so I got my booster, but I still got Covid, which is unfortunate.
(10:26-10:33): It was very similar for me. I didn't get Covid till after vaccines and boosters.
(17:27-17:32): Yeah, I think very similar kind of what would be depending on cases, and 2 similar kind of if I'm there and already getting a shot, why not a second?
vaccine_importance: The participant seems to view vaccines as somewhat important, primarily for personal safety and convenience, but not necessarily essential.
booster_importance: The participant's view on booster importance is somewhat neutral, depending on the COVID rate at the time and whether it's convenient to get it with the flu shot.
cognitive_complexity: The participant demonstrates a moderate level of cognitive complexity by considering various factors influencing their decisions about vaccinations and boosters, such as personal risk, convenience, and potential side effects.
general_notes: The participant is a college student who experienced the pandemic during their senior year of high school and early college years. They express a desire for normalcy and convenience in their approach to vaccinations and boosters.
